titleStmt.title: The two ioyful lovers, or, A true pattern of love the maid at first was most unkinde, yet bore at last a faithful minde : for Cupid with his bow and shield, at last did force her for to yield : the tune is, Francis Phoenix.
titleStmt.author: Robins, Thomas, fl. 1672-1685.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Sarah Tyus on London-Bridge.,

notesStmt.note: Attributed to Thomas Robins by Wing (2nd ed.).
Date of publication suggested by Wing (2nd ed.).
First line: Awake, awake from slumbering sleep.
Text chiefly printed in black letter in 4 columns with two woodcuts.
Reproduction of original in: National Library of Scotland--Crawford Collections.
